org.processmining.hybridilpminer.models.abstraction.interfaces

Interface LPLogAbstraction<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Generic indicator for the type used to identify an activity, e.g. XEventClass
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLPLogAbstraction, LPXEventClassBasedXLogToIntArrAbstractionImpl

    public interface LPLogAbstraction<T>
    An LPLogAbstraction is an abstraction of an event log which is in line with the general abstraction used in (I)LP-based Process Discovery. Each event class in the log will be mapped to some integer. Each trace in a log will be mapped to a multi-set representing parikh values of the prefix of the trace and a single element representing the final activity. For example if we have trace with mapping a -> 0, b -> 1, c -> 2 (i.e. we only have event classes a,b and c in the event log) then this trace maps to the array [1,1,0,2].
    Author:
    svzelst
